title: Reading Topshop death: Shoppers left in tears as 10-year-old boy is killed after 'pulling barrier down in store'
text:

A witness has told how shoppers inside a Topshop store were left in tears after a 10-year-old boy died in the popular shop. 
The boy suffered severe head injuries after a piece of store furniture fell on top of him inside the Oracle Shopping Centre in Reading yesterday. 
The schoolboy died in hospital just an hour after the incident happened on the first day of the school half term holidays. 
Today, Erika Fabiane Silva told of the moment he was asked to leave the shop. 
He wrote on Facebook that he was at the store when the accident happened. Read More Half-term tragedy as boy, 10, dies 'after furniture falls on him' in Topshop branch Ambulances outside the shopping centre in Reading today 
He said: “They asked for us to get out of the door and the people that were inside were all crying.” 
He described it as an “accident with furniture” and that the youngster had “hurt his head”. 
The schoolboy died in hospital just an hour after the incident happened. 
Unconfirmed reports suggested he had pulled a barrier down inside the store. 
Paramedics and police rushed to the Oracle Centre in the pedestrianised area of Reading shortly after 4pm and found the boy lying on the floor. 
He had a major head trauma and was unconscious. 
Medics treated him as he lay on the floor before he was rushed to the nearby Royal Berkshire Hospital in Reading, where tragically he was later confirmed dead. 
In a short statement a spokesman for Thames Valley Police said: "We were called by the South Central Ambulance Service at around 4.15pm this afternoon to a retail store at the Oracle shopping centre, Reading. 
"On attendance they found that a 10-year-old boy had suffered serious head injuries after an incident involving store furniture. 
"The boy was taken to the Royal Berkshire Hospital where sadly he was pronounced dead. His next of kin have been informed. 
"At this time the death is being treated as unexplained but non-suspicious and police are making further inquiries." Read More Brave dad takes on 'Rambo knife' thugs at girl's 16th birthday party then confiscates their weapons 
The death is likely to be referred to the Health and Safety Executive for a full investigation and a report was expected to be prepared for the Berkshire Coroner Peter Bedford. 
The tragedy mirrors the death of a four-year-old boy in 2013 who died after suffering major injuries when a huge mirror fell on top of him as he shopped with his father in Hugo Boss in the upmarket Bicester shopping outlet. 
Police said that the boy was unlikely to be named until an inquest had been opened in Reading. 
It was not yet known whether the schoolboy lived locally or had come with his family to Reading to shop at the Oracle Centre. Like us on Facebook
